subject: PLDM: Encode Decode For SetEventReceiver command
commitMessage:
PLDM: Encode Decode For SetEventReceiver command

This commit adds the encode and decode functions for
the SetEventReceiver Command, which will be sent to
host with time interval and heartbeat interval, along
with enableAsyncKeepAlive for surveillance between
host and BMC

PLDM SPEC: DSP248_1.2.0 TABLE 13

Signed-off-by: Sagar Srinivas <sagar.srinivas@ibm.com>
Change-Id: I20613124a0787eb4f60945e923d1fc6afa4db31b

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 535bccdf6d5f2b34cbf6a2510b5268c7ad4d0375 by Sampa Misra
and also a brief write up that what it will be used for

Could you show your spec?
e.g: DSP_2048_1.2.0 Table_xx.
how was this decided to be uint8_t, the spec says it varies based on the transport protocol type.
confused, i don't see this in the spec , can you point me to which table in the spec you are following ?

Table-13 DSP0248_1.2.0.pdf
the event receiver address info varies based on the protocol chosen. as of now only MCTP is supported and acc to that event receiver field is one byte
this can be changed if someone uses a different protocol later
i think this is not needed now as you are not supporting OEM protocol as per your code
+1 , please talk about the unit tests &  `encode_xxx_resp` and `decode_xxx_req` methods in the commit message , if you are not willing to do this in this commit.
`encode_xxx_resp` and `decode_xxx_req` methods will not be used by BMC so they are not implemented as part of this commit. That can be taken up as a new commit
yes, `encode_xxx_resp` and `decode_xxx_req` can be implemented at a later point when BMC will be using those methods. and Units tests will be pushed as a 3rd commit in the chain.
I think your UT should be push along with this commit
why are we overwriting what is present in the completion_code pointer ?
What about this ?, let me know if i am missing something ?

> why are we overwriting what is present in the completion_code pointer ?

if the CC is not success then host has not agreed to the command and sent some error code as return. so we do not decode futher fields in the response packet and just return the CC. and return PLDM_SUCCESS from the decode function because the decode function did not fail logically
Since there is no support for types other than MCTP at this point, return failure.
Add some documentation that this struct applies only for transport type MCTP.
